intro: Convolvulus bifidus, commonly known as the twinleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves that often split into two lobes. The plant produces small, pale blue to purple flowers that bloom in the early morning. It is native to regions of southern Africa and thrives in well-drained soils. Convolvulus bifidus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
